meanings.definition: A complicated or compromising relationship or situation.
meanings.sent1: Her entanglements with the new company caused her a lot of stress.
meanings.sent2: The entanglements between the two families made it difficult to resolve the issue.
meanings.sent3: His entanglements with the mischievous cat always ended in chaos.
meanings.sent4: The web of entanglements in the office was like a tangled mess of wires.
meanings.sent5: The entanglements in the plot of the movie kept the audience guessing until the end.

meanings.definition: The action of entangling or being entangled.
meanings.sent1: The quick movements resulted in the entanglements of the ropes.
meanings.sent2: Untangling the fishing line from the entanglements took a lot of patience.
meanings.sent3: The entanglements of the vines in the jungle seemed to have a mind of their own.
meanings.sent4: The dancer moved gracefully, avoiding any entanglements with her costume.
meanings.sent5: The sailor skillfully navigated through the entanglements of seaweed in the water.

meanings.sent1: The brush was full of thorns and entanglements that made it hard to pass through.
meanings.sent2: The net was designed to catch any entanglements in the machinery.
meanings.sent3: The spider's web was a masterpiece of natural entanglements.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle was full of twists and turns, creating a web of entanglements.
meanings.sent5: The forest was full of hidden entanglements waiting to trip the unwary traveler.
